bzh.plealog.bioinfo.ui.carto.data

Interface FeatureOrganizerManager


  • public interface FeatureOrganizerManager
    Interface to implement to interact with a FeatureOrganizer.
    Author:
    Patrick G. Durand

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String[] getFeatureOrderingNames()
      Let FeatureOrganizer know in which order features have to be placed on feature lanes.
      FeaturePainter getFeaturePainter(Feature feat, FeaturePainter fp)
      This method can be used to overload default FeaturePainter setup by the FeatureOrganizer for a particular Feature.

      This method can be used to overload default FGraphics setup by the FeatureOrganizer for a particular Feature.
      String getReferenceFeatureName()
      Return the name of the feature used as the reference.

    • Method Detail

      • getFeatureOrderingNames

        String[] getFeatureOrderingNames()
        Let FeatureOrganizer know in which order features have to be placed on feature lanes.
        Returns:
        an array of feature types representing the order to use to display feature lanes. Can be null.

      • getFGraphics

        FGraphics getFGraphics(Feature feat,
                     FGraphics fg)
        This method can be used to overload default FGraphics setup by the FeatureOrganizer for a particular Feature.
        Parameters:
        feat - a feature for which FeatureOrganizer wants to know graphics properties
        fg - the default graphics the FeatureOrganizer is going to assign to the feature. If you do not want to modify them, simply return this parameter as it is, or null. If you do want to set different graphic properties, MAKE a copy of fg parameter, upgrade it accordingly and return it. But never modify this parameter.
        Returns:
        feature graphics to assign to a feature. Can return null.

      • getFeaturePainter

        FeaturePainter getFeaturePainter(Feature feat,
                               FeaturePainter fp)
        This method can be used to overload default FeaturePainter setup by the FeatureOrganizer for a particular Feature.
        Parameters:
        feat - a feature for which FeatureOrganizer wants to know FeaturePainter
        fp - the default painter the FeatureOrganizer is going to assign to the feature. If you do not want to modify it, simply return this parameter as it is, or null. If you do want to set a different painter, create a new painter and return it. But never modify this parameter.
        Returns:
        feature graphics to assign to a feature. Can return null.

      • getReferenceFeatureName

        String getReferenceFeatureName()
        Return the name of the feature used as the reference.
        Returns:
        feature name.
